snippet: The plans for elections reflect a growing assurance by President Bashar al-Assad that insurgents no longer pose a credible threat to overthrow him.
abstract: Syrian officials have declared presidential vote will be held within three months, despite raging war that has driven nine million Syrians from their homes; push for elections reflect growing assurance by Pres Bashar al-Assad that insurgents no longer pose credible threat to overthrow him; opponents say elections would be absurd amid military crackdown.
lead_paragraph: The plans for elections reflect a growing assurance by President Bashar al-Assad that insurgents no longer pose a credible threat to overthrow him.

headline.seo: As War Rages in Syria, Presidential Election Looms
headline.main: In Syria, a Show of Democracy Amid Destruction
headline.print_headline: A Show of Democracy Amid Destruction

keywords.value: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
keywords.name: organizations
